author: Peter
message: What I really would like to see in gwenview browsing mode: loading thumbnails in big folders _before_ scrolling to that position, with priority for thumbnails near the current scroll position.

replies.author: Aur√©lien
replies.message: Yes, it's a most wanted... One problem is generating all thumbnails for a very large photo folder could be quite resource-intensive because right now all thumbnails are kept in memory. Another problem is to ensure decoding the requested image is given a higher priority than generating thumbnails. I agree the current behavior is not optimal though. Maybe I'll get around to fix it for 4.8.

author: crocket
message:
I want gwenview to have an option called "smooth zooming" so that people can choose when to zoom images smoothly with blur.
The current algorithm is to only zoom smoothly until the image is zoomed twice.
But I want images to be zoomed smoothly even in 500% zoom often.

replies.author: Jos Poortvliet
replies.message: Hmm, what is the usecase? I actually like the fact Gwenview is smart and zooms smoothly until it doesn't make sense anymore (200% and more). Above 200% an un-smoothed image offers more clarity while between 100 and 200 the smoothing DOES improve it. I think it's better to have Gwenview behave smart than configurable ;-)
